items.title: Broken Hill man runs 1,100km to Newcastle to raise funds for Angelman syndrome
items.summary: A Broken Hill man has run to Newcastle to raise funds and awareness for a rare condition called as Angelman syndrome.

items.title: Justin Holbrook arrives at Newcastle Knights after club's wooden spoon
items.summary: Justin Holbrook has started his tenure as Newcastle head coach, tasked with turning the struggling NRL side around.

items.title: Varroa mite could still be in SA despite removal of infected hives, PIRSA says
items.summary: PIRSA says there is a chance the deadly parasite remains in the state where it was detected for the first time earlier this month.

items.title: How to build a flourishing garden in a courtyard or smaller space
items.summary: Living in a smaller space doesn't mean you can't have a lush garden. Here's how to rejuvenate your garden with some easy tips.

items.title: Sharks vow not to taunt Raiders in sudden-death NRL semifinal as minor premiers look to bounce back
items.summary: Cronulla suggests it will not niggle Canberra in Saturday night's semifinal, despite the Brisbane Broncos successfully getting under the Raiders' skin in their thrilling one-point win.

items.title: What to know about the Macrons' legal bid to prove the French first lady was not born a man
items.summary: Emmanuel Macron and his wife, Brigitte Macron, have said they intend to provide evidence in court to disprove a right-wing influencer's claims the French first lady is transgender.

items.title: Hakyung Lee, mother accused of killing children, had a 'disease of the mind', defence expert tells court
items.summary: Hakyung Lee has been charged with murdering her children and has pleaded not guilty by reason of insanity after leaving their bodies in an Auckland storage facility.

items.title: Late-night hosts call out 'unitary intimidation' in aftermath of Jimmy Kimmel's axing
items.summary: Jimmy Kimmel's fellow late-night stars accuse the Trump administration of overriding free speech with the indefinite axing of the ABC America host, as parent company, Walt Disney, faces growing protests.

items.title: Cowboys prepare to make NRLW finals debut against Sharks in Townsville
items.summary: As the Cowboys eye the path to premiership glory ahead of their sudden-death semifinal against the Sharks, they are also creating pathways off field for the next generation of NRLW stars.

items.title: Pat Cummins hints at Ashes strategy amid recovery from back injury with 'starting aim' of playing in all five Tests
items.summary: As the men's Ashes approaches, the Australian captain reveals his hopes for taking part in the five-Test series against England as he steps up his injury recovery.

items.title: Weekly news quiz: A royal visit, a glitzy award show and a new city plays host to Laneway
items.summary: A lot happened this week. Have you been paying attention?

items.title: China urges Papua New Guinea not to exclude other countries after it signed 'Pukpuk' communique with Australia
items.summary: China has urged Papua New Guinea not to sign any deal that might exclude or restrict third parties from cooperating with the Pacific nation, as Australia scrambles to clinch a landmark defence treaty.

items.title: Green Gravity secures old coal mine shaft to test gravitational energy storage
items.summary: A disused coal mine in Wollongong will be the first test site for a renewable energy company that lowers weights down old mine shafts to spin turbines and create electricity.

items.title: RONA. weaves together country, colonialism and club music on new EP It's All Here
items.summary: This Kaytetye producer has a fresh take on the space race that draws from First Nations knowledge and culture.

items.title: Asbestos discovery further delays Willyama High School demolition
items.summary: Nearly two years after a mould-infested high school was closed indefinitely, high-risk friable asbestos has caused further delays to its demolition.

items.title: Rabbits cause 'devastating' damage to Junee cemetery in southern NSW
items.summary: The Junee Shire Council says it is battling a rabbit problem, which forced a recent closure of the town's main cemetery for a week, including on Father's Day, for a baiting program.

items.title: QCOAL's Cook Colliery coal mine in central Queensland to close half of operation
items.summary: A third Queensland coal miner has confirmed job cuts as it prepares to close one of its underground mine sites, with the company also putting the blame on rising costs and state government royalties.

items.title: Gardens of Stone State Conservation Area walks open path to incredible vistas
items.summary: New South Wales National Parks and Wildlife staff have spent 18 months transforming eroded vehicle trails into rehabilitated walks, opening previously inaccessible viewpoints.

items.title: Warm currents bring tens of thousands of giant yellowfin tuna to NSW South Coast
items.summary: Fishers are reporting an unprecedented number of yellowfin tuna travelling from the tropics to the NSW South Coast, causing "mayhem" and excitement.

items.title: Oscar Piastri says McLaren has clarified team orders after controversy at F1 Italian Grand Prix
items.summary: Formula 1 drivers' championship leader Oscar Piastri says McLaren has "had a lot of discussions" since the controversial ending to the Italian Grand Prix two weekends ago.

items.title: Australian Submarine Agency lobbies Fremantle locals amid protest over AUKUS defence hub
items.summary: A push to earn the public's trust over a defence hub south of Perth by the Australian Submarine Agency draws protesters and sceptical residents in Fremantle.

items.title: Gippsland farmer blocks AusNet maintenance workers from entering property
items.summary: A Victorian farmer who has hosted transmission lines on his property for decades says he is sick of maintenance workers damaging his property.

items.summary: The state-owned utility says advice that Port Hedland does not have enough water available to support major development was given in error.

items.summary: As the native pest destroys crops and pasture across outback Queensland, graziers say authorities must move swiftly to tackle them.

items.title: No live export ships coming for WA sheep amid high prices, looming ban
items.summary: Market dynamics are stopping live export ships from coming to WA for the rest of the year, raising the prospect of an official end to the trade years before a legislated ban is enforced.

items.title: How Hawthorn can upset Geelong as the Hawks meet the Cats in 2025 AFL preliminary final
items.summary: With a plethora of options up forward, there's one issue the Hawks need to pay attention to out of their back half if they want to upset the Cats tonight.

items.title: Young members bring new life to the Rural Fire Service
items.summary: Nearly a quarter of all western NSW Rural Fire Service volunteers are older than 70, but some younger recruits are urging others to follow in their footsteps.

items.title: AFL finals fever takes hold as fans line up to buy tickets offline

items.summary: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has seized on remarks made by Opposition Leader Sussan Ley about Australia's climate targets.

items.title: Miranda Tapsell and Gwilym Lee show it 'takes a village' to raise a child in Top End Bub
items.summary: Miranda Tapsell and Gwilym Lee return to their characters from the hit movie, Top End Wedding, to take on parenthood in the TV series, Top End Bub.

items.title: Kitchen floor at Palmerston Regional Hospital ripped up, replaced following food safety failure
items.summary: Large sections of flooring at the Northern Territory's newest, multi-million-dollar hospital are having to be ripped up and replaced after the facility failed food safety checks.

items.summary: Copper production is on the chopping block in outback Queensland, with mining giant Glencore about to decide on its future. What is the cost of losing a legacy industry?

items.title: ASX rises, Aus Post to resume US parcel deliveries sooner, and BoJ leaves rates unchanged — as it happened
items.summary: The Australian share market gained, after Wall Street's S&P 500 hit a record high, and the Bank of Japan kept its policy rate steady at 0.5 per cent.

items.title: Riverina family grapples with daughter's devastating childhood dementia diagnosis
items.summary: Rachel Anderson says she knew something was not right when her daughter Hannah began struggling to remember things she had just done.

items.title: Surprise La Niña hints at another wet and stormy Australian summer
items.summary: Australia's key drivers of weather variability are stacking up to produce another wet, severe-weather season, with an increased risk of flooding, thunderstorms and cyclones.

items.title: Man fined for dumping 'volatile' chemicals into gutter on suburban Adelaide street
items.summary: An Adelaide man who emptied drums containing hazardous chemicals into a suburban gutter — causing nearby residents to experience headaches and nausea — has been fined thousands of dollars.

items.title: Carnival of Flowers visitors brace for wet weather while smelling the roses
items.summary: Visitors flocking to Queensland's Darling Downs for the annual Carnival of Flowers in Toowoomba are advised to take an umbrella, with thunderstorms forecast for the region.

items.title: Drug checking services handed bitter pill as Queensland government rams through law changes
items.summary: The Queensland government has been unrepentant in its tough stance on drugs, with Health Minister Tim Nicholls telling state parliament this week it doesn't "support drug dealers", writes Janelle Miles.

items.title: Parents call for football club culture change after death of 21-year-old son
items.summary: Steven Callanan had the world at his feet and loved footy like it was a religion. The talented player could bring together communities while he played, but after a night of partying he took his own life.

items.title: Home owners warned to consider 'liveability' of properties amid climate change impact warning
items.summary: Property experts say a "dizzying" report forecasting the impacts of worsening climate conditions on Australian properties has sounded a clear warning for the sector.

items.title: Gout Gout's understanding of patience shows World Athletics Championships performance in 200m semifinal won't be one off
items.summary: Gout Gout's promise and progress are on full display at the 2025 World Athletics Championships. But by showing patience, he could get even better.

items.title: Therapists, patients raise concerns over The Hobart Clinic closure with fears it could be 'dangerous' for some
items.summary: For more than four decades, The Hobart Clinic has provided private mental health services to clients. Since the announcement of its October closure, clinic staff, therapists and patients have warned of the negative impact on those reliant on the service.

items.title: First Guardian, Shield superannuation disasters expose deep flaws in Australia's $4.3 trillion retirement system
items.summary: The failed First Guardian and Shield schemes have cost about 12,000 Australians more than $1 billion in retirement savings and exposed deep flaws in how Australia's $4.3 trillion superannuation sector is regulated.

items.title: The climate conversation is stuck in a loop, but out in the world things are changing
items.summary: We don't have to wait for moonshot technologies to reach our climate targets. Most of the solutions to the climate crisis are already around us.

items.title: After deadly floods in Bali, its people want answers. Many are blaming overtourism
items.summary: Unexpected and deadly flooding rocked Bali last week at a scale many had never experienced before. In the wake of this disaster, the search for answers has begun.

items.title: AI-generated minister addresses Albanian parliament for first time
items.summary: The world's first AI government minister was appointed last week by Albania's prime minister to oversee decisions on public tenders and to ease voter concerns about corruption.

items.title: Trump says Jimmy Kimmel off-air for 'bad ratings' as Democrats slam regulator for 'bullying' US ABC
items.summary: Prominent leaders in the Democratic Party are accusing the US's communications regulator of "bullying" a network to take the long-running late night show off air.

items.title: All the latest financial news
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Police officer found not guilty of assault during shopping centre scuffle at Batemans Bay
items.summary: A New South Wales police officer is found not guilty of using unreasonable force while removing three girls and a woman from a scuffle at a shopping centre.

items.title: Man charged with threatening to kill pro-Palestinian rally organiser Remah Naji
items.summary: Queensland counter-terrorism detectives charge a man with making verbal threats via a carriage service to Remah Naji, a spokesperson for a Brisbane-based pro-Palestinian action group.

items.title: Ry Jacob Nairn charged with murder after body found in Northampton
items.summary: Ry Jacob Nairn has faced Geraldton Magistrates Court over the death of a 69-year-old man in Northampton earlier this week.

items.title: Bindi Magic art exhibition opens in Alice Springs as organisation celebrates 25 years
items.summary: For 25 years Bindi Mwerre Anthurre Artists has been helping people with a disability to communicate through creativity.

items.title: Roosters hand Victor Radley 10-match ban for bringing NRL club into disrepute
items.summary: The Sydney Roosters suspend Victor Radley for 10 matches without pay following media revelations he allegedly requested an illegal substance from former teammate Brandon Smith.

items.title: Jimmy Kimmel is the latest to be put on pause. How Trump is influencing the world of late-night TV
items.summary: Emmys watchers could assume there's never been a better time in Hollywood to hold its most powerful to account, but Jimmy Kimmel's axing proves otherwise.

items.title: The Albanese government has learned from the last major climate commitment
items.summary: The government is keenly aware that the cost of the transition is a sensitive issue, which is why the prime minister was flanked not just by his climate minister but also his treasurer.

items.title: Henley residents advised to keep windows, doors closed amid algal bloom crisis
items.summary: Authorities have told a group of residents living near a metropolitan Adelaide beach to close their doors and windows to prevent symptoms related to South Australia's ongoing algal bloom.

items.title: WA coal phase-out uncertainty amid Bluewaters power station closure backflip
items.summary: Efforts by WA's government to force the premature closure of a privately owned coal plant appear to be unravelling after the market operator backed the power station to keep running towards the end of the decade.

items.title: Albury Wodonga Regional Cancer Centre to become public hospital
items.summary: A major cancer centre on the Victorian-New South Wales border will become a fully public hospital in a move that has caught a healthcare provider by surprise and sparked community concern.

items.title: National Gathering backs plans for new First Nations body, but tensions remain
items.summary: First Nations leaders have endorsed plans for a new national representative body to be established. Here’s what we know.

items.title: Albanese to meet with Trump after returning from Pacific empty-handed
items.summary: This week in politics, the prime minister returned home from the Pacific empty-handed and the climate debate continued to unsettle the Coalition.

items.title: Domestic violence comments on fishing show breached classification rules: ACMA
items.summary: An exchange about domestic violence between 'Bush Cook Ranger Nick' and the host of Step Outside with Paul Burt, broadcast on 7mate, was in breach of classification rules, the watchdog has found.

items.title: Family of Aboriginal man killed in Darwin hit-and-run speak out over driver's sentence
items.summary: The family of an Aboriginal man killed in a hit-and-run in Darwin have spoken out about the sentence handed to the man who killed him, and the "racist, dehumanising" messages he sent afterwards.

items.title: Disability employment provider Bedford's financial situation concerns SA, federal government
items.summary: The federal disability minister says his concerns about Australia's second-largest disability employment provider, Bedford, have grown.

items.title: Hobart stadium proponent dismisses planning commission key issues as 'matters of opinion'
items.summary: The agency behind Hobart's Macquarie Point stadium build says it is undeterred by the three key issues raised by the recent planning commission's final report, arguing it comes down to "priorities".
